util
Interface Set2D

All Known Implementing Classes:
QuadTree
public interface Set2D

A set of moveable objects in a rectangular region of 2D space, retrievable by position. Each object has a unique non-negative integer identifier. Implementations may assume that the maximum identifier is a small multiple of SIZE (). All objects in a Set2D reside within a bounding rectangle, whose coordinates are retrievable.

Method Summary
 void add(int id, double x, double y)
          Add a point unique identifier ID and initial position (X,Y) to THIS.
 boolean exists(int id)
          True iff ID is the unique id of an object in THIS.
 Set2DIterator iterator()
          A Set2DIterator that returns all objects in THIS, sorted by id.
 Set2DIterator iterator(double xl, double yl, double xu, double yu)
          A Set2DIterator that returns all objects in THIS whose coordinates lie on or within a rectangle whose lower-left coordinate is (XL, YL) and whose upper-right coordinate is (XU, YU).
 double llx()
          The smallest x-coordinate allowed for objects in THIS.
 double lly()
          The smallest y-coordinate allowed for objects in THIS.
 void remove(int id)
          Remove the object whose unique identifier is ID, if any, and otherwise do nothing.
 void set(int id, double x, double y)
          Modify the point with unique identifier ID in THIS to have position (X,Y) in THIS.
 int size()
          The current number of objects in the set.
 double urx()
          The largest x-coordinate allowed for objects in THIS.
 double ury()
          The largest y-coordinate allowed for objects in THIS.
 double x(int id)
          The x-coordinate of the object whose unique identifier is ID, if any; otherwise NaN.
 double y(int id)
          The y-coordinate of the object whose unique identifier is ID, if any; otherwise NaN.
 

Method Detail

size


int size()
The current number of objects in the set.

add


void add(int id,

         double x,

         double y)
Add a point unique identifier ID and initial position (X,Y) to THIS. Causes an IllegalArgumentException if ID < 0, (X,Y) is not in the bounding rectangle, or if exists (ID).

set


void set(int id,

         double x,

         double y)
Modify the point with unique identifier ID in THIS to have position (X,Y) in THIS. Causes an IllegalArgumentException if ! exists (ID) or if (X,Y) is not within the bounding rectangle.

remove


void remove(int id)
Remove the object whose unique identifier is ID, if any, and otherwise do nothing.

exists


boolean exists(int id)
True iff ID is the unique id of an object in THIS.

llx


double llx()
The smallest x-coordinate allowed for objects in THIS. All objects must have an x-coordinate that is >= llx ().

lly


double lly()
The smallest y-coordinate allowed for objects in THIS. All objects must have an y-coordinate that is >= lly ().

urx


double urx()
The largest x-coordinate allowed for objects in THIS. All objects must have an x-coordinate that is < urx ().

ury


double ury()
The largest y-coordinate allowed for objects in THIS. All objects must have an y-coordinate that is < ury ().

x


double x(int id)
The x-coordinate of the object whose unique identifier is ID, if any; otherwise NaN.

y


double y(int id)
The y-coordinate of the object whose unique identifier is ID, if any; otherwise NaN.

iterator


Set2DIterator iterator()
A Set2DIterator that returns all objects in THIS, sorted by id.

iterator


Set2DIterator iterator(double xl,

                       double yl,

                       double xu,

                       double yu)
A Set2DIterator that returns all objects in THIS whose coordinates lie on or within a rectangle whose lower-left coordinate is (XL, YL) and whose upper-right coordinate is (XU, YU).
